newsitem.title: INDIA: India Ponds 1996 net up 24 pct.
newsitem.headline: India Ponds 1996 net up 24 pct.

text.p: Unilever subsidiary and cosmetics maker Ponds India Ltd said on Wednesday its 1996 net profit rose 24 percent to 469.5 million rupees against 378.0 million in the year-ago period.
The company said net sales rose 25 percent to 3.95 billion rupees from 3.17 billion in 1995. Gross profit before depreciation and interest climbed 20 percent to 680 million against 570 million.
Ponds said depreciation totalled 34 million rupees against 26 million a year ago. Interest costs more than halved to two million from five million in 1995.
Earnings per share was at 33.60 rupees against 27 rupees a year ago.
"Personal products continue to be the flagship business of the company," Ponds said in a statement.
